author: cronoss5638
content:
Why should miners trust that developers will not simply keep track of, and subsequently fork out of existence, their 'future ETH', immediately post-merge?
Should the payment mechanism not require that some sort of indistinguishability between regular eth and 'future miner eth' is achieved pre-merge?
(Forgive me if this makes no sense)

author: sky.cactus
content: That is an issue with promising future funds which I have brought up before.

author: cronoss5638
content:
Hmm I don't know enough about eth2 to answer that one. But if not, I would argue that there would be plenty of time until merge to add any required functionality.
Assuming there is no trust, I think it would be unwise for miners to hedge their future eth on the *ethereum developers* not  being able to do something (without some sort of cryptographic assurance.)
